content: There has been talk of switching q and w. I think 1.7 is as good a time as any to make breaking hotkey changes. Thoughts?

sweet. Any other breaking hotkey changes we want to make for 1.7? On my list:

  • C -> x
  • Remove A and D (to be replaced with keyboard navigation of the left sidebar, or ctrl-shift-down, or something else to be decided later)
  • switch q and w
  • switch s and S, or change s to be a toggle between topic and stream narrow.

Hasn't yet been discussed:

  • Possibly P should be p?
  • I think having n and S in stream settings is a bit confusing, especially n, which is in the top five hotkeys we want everyone to learn. E.g. currently if you hover over the create-new-stream button in stream settings, the title text is "Create new stream (n)", which is confusing if you think n = next unread topic (partly since most other products don't reuse hotkeys in this way).
    I think the natural hotkey for "create a new stream" is one that should be usable from the main webapp, though I don't have a good proposal. Maybe alt+shift+s?
    I think it would be good to replace stream settings S as well, if anyone has ideas. Maybe t, for toggle subscription?
Al these ideas same good to me.
switching q/w seems good to do fast; the rest I feel like are bigger risks. @Joshua Pan would you be able to do the q/w swap quickly?
@Tim Abbott done #6658
(Ran node tests locally, but probably should wait for Travis)

Another hotkey we should consider re-mapping is ESC -> H, to avoid the nasty pitfall of ESC dumping you into a confusing interleaved view when you aren't expecting it.

I understand TIm's concern about the risk for 1.7, so I wonder if it makes sense to do most of the re-mappings in a quick follow up release? I'd be up for calling the subsequent release 1.8, because even if it doesn't contain lots of stuff, we could treat it as a release where we undo a few legacy decisions.

ah yeah. I feel like the discussion at the time was around making ESC/H a user option? Since the people that like ESC to home really like it, and the people that don't really don't.
Bumping to 1.8 is reasonable, if it's too late to get these in to 1.7.
Yeah, I think we shouldn't do the rest of these for 1.7; it feels too risky to add at this late point.
